node.text:
@independent_hq opened this week in its new home at the Battery Maritime Building located on South Street Seaport, and will run until September 12. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
To complement the IRL fair, Independent will host its first ever online viewing room, with a robust offering of digital material such as artist interviews and studio visits, including this specially commissioned film - shared exclusively with Wallpaper* - with the artist Leilah Babirye, whose work will be on show with Gordon Robichaux Gallery (@gordonrobichaux) as part of Independent. ⁣⁣

Babirye came to the US in 2015, two years after the anti homosexuality bill was passed in Uganda. “I was really active in the gay community, I was physically among the people being outed in the different tabloids by then,” the artist says. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
“I thought, why don’t I reuse what other people cant use? So all my work is produced from recycle. The wood is recycled from the lumber yard; used wood from the building site or road sites, not from the forest. All the material around that I use is all found material. For the clay work, its clay and then I make sure I add a piece that is found. That is how my work is created. I want to be free because where the world is getting so complicated, and I don’t like complication.” ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Read our full piece with all the highlights from Independent New York at wallpaper.com, via link in bio.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#IndependentArtFair #LeilahBabirye #GordonRobichaus #Art #WallpaperMagazine⁣⁣

node.title: Independent New York presents Leilah Babirye

node.text:
New photography book 'Haçienda Landscapes' – which explores the modern myth and magic of the Manchester club – has launched on Kickstarter.

Here, watch designer Ben Kelly (@the.photo.kid) and photographer (@eugene_schlumberger) discuss the project, and head to wallpaper.com to read more about it.

Film: Max Smith
#WallpaperMagazine #design #clubculture #books #kickstarter #Hacienda #BenKelly #photography

node.text:
Maserati's first mild hybrid electric vehicle, the Ghibli Hybrid combines intense power and reduced fuel consumption and emissions with the pure exhilaration of driving a Maserati. In the Ghibli Hybrid, Maserati has created something of beauty, power and audacity that also has a meaningful impact on our present.

@maseratigb #Maserati #MaseratiGhibliHybrid #SparkTheNext

node.text:
K11 MUSEA in Hong Kong has deployed 11 autonomous robot cleaners. 🤖

Armed with sterilising solution that’s proven to eliminate 99.99% of germs and viruses, you can spot the autonomous robots spraying and sanitising the air and every nook and cranny of K11 MUSEA, which is set to reopen at midday tomorrow (6 March).

Here, watch as they sanitise the 340,000 sq ft @K11Musea premises, and have some fun once the day’s work is done.

Read more about the design behind the K11 art and retail complex at wallpaper.com.

@AdrianCheng #WallpaperMagazine #design #film

node.text:
Bosco Sodi (@studioboscosodi)'s paintings are often monumental in scale – the titular piece of his breakthrough show, Pangaea at the Bronx Museum (2010) measured 4m x 12m – so it may come as a surprise that the artist prefers to work by himself.⁠
⁠
We visited Sodi's studio in September 2020 to discover his creative process, witnessing the mixing of his paints (made from personally-sourced pigments, sawdust, glue and water), and the unique process by which he creates his work. Lying the canvases flat atop upturned buckets, he throws on fistfuls of paints with his bare hands, splattering layer upon layer over a four to five day period.⁠
⁠
‘And when I see the first crack, I stop totally and let the painting go by itself,' he explains. 'Because if I get into the painting when it’s already becoming alive, it would not have that natural and organic feeling.’⁠
⁠
Learn more in our studio profile on wallpaper.com⁠
⁠(Video by @spenciv and @peterelliotteaton⁠)
⁠
#boscosodi @cacmalaga @kasmingallery @pioneerworks #painting #contemporaryart #wallpapermagazine

node.text:
Initiated and carried out against the backdrop of a global pandemic, ‘Connected’ – Benchmark’s (@madebybenchmark) latest collaborative project with the American Hardwood Export Council (@ahec_europe) – has seen nine designers come up with something that would enhance their working-from-home experience. The obvious twist is that they have been unable to visit the workshop or see their pieces in the flesh, and have instead relied on a lot of Zoom calls, countless WhatsApp conversations, and a good helping of trust.

Nine designers chose from three woods to work with: red oak, maple and cherry. The material, as well as the lockdown, appears to have reignited an appreciation for the natural world in the designers. From Thomas Heatherwick’s maple planters, CNC-carved using an algorithm based on biomimicry and providing welcome greenery at his new London home, to Studiopepe’s ‘Pink Moon’ chair based on lunar movement, ‘each designer has drawn on nature in order to feel closer to it.

Read more at wallpaper.com, via link in bio. 

#wallpapermagazine #americanhardwood #connectedbydesign

@designmuseum @officialheatherwickstudio @studiopepe_official @iniarchibong @jaimehayon @sebastianherkner @studio_swine @mariajeglinska @bruundesign @sabine_marcelis

node.text:
Acerbis

As the new art directors of Italian brand @acerbis_design, Francesco Meda and David Lopez Quincoces spent time delving into the archive, uncovering classic pieces from bygone collections.

Their findings are presented in this film, Sinestesia, which is shot entirely on 16mm and produced manually without any filters or digital effects, as a nod to the decades-long roots of these visionary designs. Drawing on the neurological phenomena Synesthesia, the film visualises the sensations of shapes, colors, and sounds seen throughout the collection.

‘Objects possess a life of their own — more than a mere unity of materials, every creation engenders a universe of emotions, history, and the ideas that produced it,’ they say.

Read more at acerbisdesign.com

#design #acerbisdesign #film #designfilm

@acerbis_design @francescomeda @quincocesdrago @ps.designconsultants

Credits

Art Direction & Design: Francesco Meda, David Lopez Quincoces
Video director: Lorenzo Gironi
Creative Direction: Mattia Orso Mangano

node.text:
For our 25th anniversary project, '5x5', we called on five visionaries who have shaped the world of Wallpaper*, and invited each of them to put forward five creative leaders of the future.⁣
 ⁣
Among our visionaries is @theastergates, the Chicago-based artist, urban planner and changemaker. Ahead of an ambitious cultural takeover in London – encompassing shows at @whitechapelgallery and @whitecube Mason's Yard, an intervention at @vamuseum 's ceramics galleries, and commission to create the 2022 @serpentineuk pavilion, we caught up with him on the history of clay, art as a social force, and nurturing the next generation through his new @dorchester_industries Experimental Design Lab.⁣
 ⁣
Read more about Gates, and his pick of five talents – @normanteaguedesignstudios, @walesbonner, Germane Barnes (@gmane16), @tolucoker and Kendall Reynolds (@kendallgalore) – at the link in bio.⁣
 ⁣
The October 25th anniversary issue of Wallpaper* is on newsstands now.⁣
 ⁣
Portraits: Caroline Tompkins (@cahlinetompkins)⁣
Photography: @chrisstrongphotography © Theaster Gates ; Joe Kramm (@joeinstakramm), courtesy of R & Company; @seanandseng; Ade Coker (@adecokercola)⁣
⁣
#wallpapermagazine #wallpaper25 #theastergates #aquestionofclay #aclaysermon #contemporaryart #americanart⁣

node.text:
For our 25th anniversary project, '5x5', we called on five visionaries who have shaped the world of Wallpaper*, and invited each of them to put forward five creative leaders of the future.⁣
⁣
Among our visionaries is @fridaescobedo, the prolific Mexican architect who  created the widely acclaimed 2018 @serpentineuk pavilion. A champion of diversity and female creativity, she currently has 15 projects on the go and is about to lead a new design workshop at @yalearchitecture. ⁣
 ⁣
Yet she made time to share with us her recommendations for five creative leaders of the future – ‘all extraordinary architects’ – including @marinatabassum, Amanda Williams (@awstudioart), @carlajuacaba, Gabriella Carrillo (@gabcarrillo) and Mariam Kamara (@atmasomi).⁣
 ⁣
Read more about Escobedo, and her pick of five talents at the link in bio.⁣
 ⁣
The October 25th anniversary issue of Wallpaper* is on newsstands now.⁣
 ⁣
Portraits: Caroline Tompkins (@cahlinetompkins)⁣
Photography: @rafaelgamo; Ramiro Chaves (@rrraaammmchaves); Sandro di Carlo Darsa (@sandrophoto); Amanda Williams (@awstudioart); @federicocairoli⁣, @onnisluque_fotografia; James Wang @jameswangyipeng⁣
 ⁣
#wallpapermagazine #wallpaper25 #fridaescobedo #mexicanarchitecture #contemporaryarchitecture⁣

node.text:
Discovered is now open at the @designmuseum until the 10 October. ⁠A collaboration between @ahec_europe and Wallpaper*, the exhibition presents the work of twenty young designers from 16 countries.

The designers were tasked with creating new objects in wood, inspired by their pandemic experience to represent the functional and emotional connections to our everyday items.⁠ 

Over the course of several months, each designer developed a piece in collaboration with specialist workshops, working with a specially selected palette of woods. American red oak, cherry, hard and soft maple were chosen for their tactile and visual appeal, and to address the sustainable opportunity of designing with underused and widely available timber that grows abundantly in the American hardwood forests, and has incredible design and performance potential.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
With designers spanning across the globe, from Columbia to Singapore, the collection is a diverse representation of culture, heritage and social identity, all brought together under one roof.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Explore the designs and find out more about the exhibition at wallpaper.com, via the link in bio.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
A big thank you to all of our participating designers: ⁠⠀
@sizaralexis, @isabellebaudraz, @nong_kornpetch, @maccollins__, @pascal_hien, @kodaiiwamoto, @josh_krute, @_kumsuka_, @budd.designstudio, @tra.ng.trang, @alessandra.romario, @taihoshin, @miminat_designs, @juancarlosfg, @juan.santiagosierra, @ivanataylordesign, @mratin, @dorisofia21, @vivienne_l_wong, @helloweixiang, @duncanyoungstudios⁠⠀
⁠⠀
#WallpaperMagazine #DiscoveredGlobal #DesignersforTomorrow #SustainableHardwoods

node.text:
Modernist architecture and Black culture come together at online platform Hood Century (@hoodmidcenturymodern).⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Spotlighted in our new series with Ghana-based spatial practice @limboaccra, the project was conceived by Jerald ‘Coop’ Cooper in 2019 as a space dedicated to documenting midcentury finds from Coop’s childhood neighbourhood in Cincinnati. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
As a Black person, Coop has often felt disillusioned when navigating design spaces. ‘We love architecture and design, but we want to feel like we can participate,’ he says. ‘Why is the dominant way of presenting [art] in a white gallery? What if Black art was never made for that space?’ The platform soon became a springboard to unpack myriad themes, exploring the intersection between archive, education and activism in urban preservation.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Coop and Limbo Accra founder Dominique Petit-Frère, founder of pioneering Ghana-based spatial practice @limboaccra, connected through their shared interest in the built environment and how it is experienced through the lens and perspective of Africa and its diaspora. The fruit of their collaboration takes form in a new architectural initiative gearing up to unfold in Accra at the end of the year.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Find out more about the collaboration and the work of Hood Century at wallpaper.com via link in bio.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
📸 Image 1: Church in Cincinnati, OH shot by @hoodmidcenturymodern⁠⠀
📸 Images 2 - 3: Architecture in Abidjan, Ivory Coast, shot by Dominique Petit-Frère for @limboaccra⁠⠀
⁠⠀
#HoodCentury #MidCenturyModern #ModernistArchitecture #LimboAccra #ArchitecturalPhotography⁠⠀

node.text:
British designer @leebroom has launched his first ever candle - and the collection lives up to the unabashed modern glamour we’ve come to expect from him.⁠
⁠
The design is a sculptural piece comprised of a translucent block case that holds an aluminium vessel finished in either polished gunmetal or gold. Made from 100 per cent natural soy wax, the candles and are available in two scents, On Reflection and Self Portrait. ⁠
⁠
‘The candle glides smoothly into the crystal’s interior to sit suspended perfectly within, like it is floating,’ says Broom, speaking to us ahead of the collection’s official launch at the London Design Festival (@l_d_f_official). ⁠
⁠
‘Once the candle is finished, it can be replaced with a new candle from the range. I like the sense of permanence of the solid crystal holder and also the versatility of the different candle refills, which we plan to launch more of in the coming years.’ ⁠
⁠
The scents themselves have been crafted by a French perfume house and feature fragrance notes that hold personal significance for Broom⁠
⁠
Take a closer look at the collection at wallpaper.com, via the link in bio.⁠
⁠
#WallpaperMagazine #LeeBroom #Candle #Fragrance  #Design #LDF21⁠

node.text:
@independent_hq opened this week in its new home at the Battery Maritime Building located on South Street Seaport, and will run until September 12. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
To complement the IRL fair, Independent will host its first ever online viewing room, with a robust offering of digital material such as artist interviews and studio visits, including this specially commissioned film - shared exclusively with Wallpaper* - with the artist Leilah Babirye, whose work will be on show with Gordon Robichaux Gallery (@gordonrobichaux) as part of Independent. ⁣⁣

Babirye came to the US in 2015, two years after the anti homosexuality bill was passed in Uganda. “I was really active in the gay community, I was physically among the people being outed in the different tabloids by then,” the artist says. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
“I thought, why don’t I reuse what other people cant use? So all my work is produced from recycle. The wood is recycled from the lumber yard; used wood from the building site or road sites, not from the forest. All the material around that I use is all found material. For the clay work, its clay and then I make sure I add a piece that is found. That is how my work is created. I want to be free because where the world is getting so complicated, and I don’t like complication.” ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Read our full piece with all the highlights from Independent New York at wallpaper.com, via link in bio.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#IndependentArtFair #LeilahBabirye #GordonRobichaus #Art #WallpaperMagazine⁣⁣

node.text:
To mark Wallpaper’s 25th anniversary, we invited @danielarsham to create our limited-edition cover this month. ⁠
⁠
The epic design features our very own logo rendered in the artist’s signature style (typically reserved for pop-cultural icons of the past and present, such as telephones, Pokemon, boomboxes and supercars).⁠
⁠
 ‘The cover artwork imagines the Wallpaper* magazine as an eroding version of itself found in a distant future’ says Arsham. ‘The masthead has fallen from its normal position on the top of the magazine and is instead crumbling near the bottom of the magazine.’⁠
⁠
The recognisable cover treatment is a poetic counterpoint to Arsham’s second furniture collection, ‘Objects for Living II’, which is currently being exhibited at design gallery Friedman Benda in New York City. Building on the first collection of furniture that Arsham produced for the gallery in 2019, these new additions see Arsham continue his exploration of structural, material and temporal contrasts in functional form. ⁠
⁠
Read more about Daniel Arsham’s cover design and our latest issue at the link in bio.⁠
⁠
#WallpaperMagazine #Wallpaper25  #DanielArsham #Art #Design #anniversaryissue

node.text:
Wallpaper* turns 25 years old! Our celebratory October 2021 anniversary issue hits the newsstands today.⁠⁣
⁠⁣
It’s the perfect distillation of what makes Wallpaper* so special. Former editors-in-chief Tyler Brûlé, @jeremylangmead and Tony Chambers (@tcandfriends), as well as other esteemed members of the big Wallpaper* family, share their thoughts on past exploits and challenges, before we delve right into the next 25 years by inviting five visionaries – @fridaescobedo, @theastergates, @formafantasma, Michèle Lamy (@lalamichmich) and @nendo_official – to each select five creative leaders of the future.⁠⁣
⁠⁣
We reveal the ever-brilliant artist @danielarsham ‘s furniture range with design gallery @friedman_benda (he even designed an epic limited-edition cover for our birthday), while Peter Saville and @kvadrattextiles take us on a Technicolour tour with a collection of new fabrics.⁠⁣
⁠⁣
We also introduce our first-ever edition of Weddingpaper*, a guide to your ‘very Wallpaper*’ nuptial choices. Following this, we also present an 18-page showcase of this season’s glitziest looks, and celebrate our coveted annual architects’ directory. ⁠⁣
⁠⁣
See the link in bio for the full message from our editor-in-chief @sarah_c_douglas⁠⁣
⁠⁣
#WallpaperMagazine #fashion #design #art #wallpaper25 #anniversaryissue #danielarsham

node.text:
Dutch designer Stefan Scholten (@studiostefanscholten) presents The Stone House, marking his solo debut at Salone del Mobile (@isaloniofficial), as part of ‘Masterly – The Dutch in Milano’ exhibition at Palazzo Turati. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
For this project, Scholten was influenced by living and working in Forte dei Marmi, in an area of Italy best known for its marble quarries. Keen to explore a way to repurpose stone waste, the designer began in-depth material research, visiting local quarries for inspiration. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
The project, he says, is about finding new and creative ways to upcycle stone waste. ‘Sustainability is no longer a trend, but a necessity. This awareness also applies to the stone industry, where the quantity of unused material is massive.’
⁠⠀
The results are a series of minimalist furniture pieces (a series of dining chairs, a bench, a coffee table and a dining table), the house’s walls and even a carpet. Traditional techniques such as terrazzo are pushed to new aesthetic extremes with a mix of bold colours, geometric shapes and graphic combinations. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Explore more of the installation at wallpaper.com, via link in bio.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
#StefanScholten #studiostefanscholten #SuperSalone21 #SalonedelMobile#SuperSalone #Fuorisalone#MilanDesignWeek#WallpaperMagazine ⁠⠀⁠⠀

node.text:
Space-age video games meet ancestral pottery in the ceramic art of @king.houndekpinkou.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Of Beninese origin, the artist was born and raised in the suburbs of Paris. As a video game-obsessed kid, he developed a fascination for Japan’s pop culture, taking his first trip there at age 22, where he stumbled upon traditional ceramics, which sparked his curiosity.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Back in Paris, he trained with a Japanese ceramics teacher, Kayoko Hayasaki. While accompanying Hayasaki to central France for a project with Japanese ceramicists, he met the ceramics master Toshiaki Shibuta, whom he now refers to as his spiritual father. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
‘I was drawn to the animist rituals they practised. They prayed to the “kiln god”, drank sake, heaped up salt and scattered flowers to ward off evil, so that the firing of their ceramics would go well,’ explains the artist. ‘Our countries are 13,000km apart, but what a resemblance! Shintoism and African Voodoo share a strong connection to nature. Our rituals are about humility.’⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Since then, ceramics has become a medium for interrogating his identity and his roots. Each year, he travels to both countries, bringing back to Paris a bit of soil from each location that he blends into a hybrid clay.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Delve into the artist's creative universe and take a closer look at his work via the link in bio and in our September 2021 Issue, on newsstands now, and available to download at wallpaper.com.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
📸 : @alexandreguirkinger⁠⠀
⁠⠀
#KingHoundekpinkou #Ceramics #CeramicArt #WallpaperMagazine ⁠⠀

node.text:
In an installation at @unifor_official’s Milan showroom, @ron_gilad_official  reimagines furniture designs by Aldo Rossi in a surrealistic urban piazza.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
ArchivioUniFor is a series of re-editions, looking at four of the brand’s key designs by Rossi: the ‘Parigi’ armchair, ‘Cartesio’ bookcase, ‘Consiglio’ table, and ‘Museo’ chair. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Gilad has reinterpreted (and fully re-engineered) the pieces for the installation. ‘Overall, my idea was to recreate an urban piazza where a person wandering around doesn’t necessarily understand the scale of things. ‘I decided to look at Aldo Rossi’s work not only considering his products but also his architecture. He played a lot with scales, volumes, and proximity and I tried to find a kind of parallel world lying in between,’ says Gilad. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Explore the installation in full at wallpaper.com, via the link in bio.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
📸 : @dsl__studio⁠⠀
⁠⠀
#UniForWorkEnvironments #RonGilad #UniFor #SuperSalone21 #SalonedelMobile#SuperSalone #Fuorisalone#MilanDesignWeek#WallpaperMagazine ⁠⠀
